description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The goal of the TBD will be to develop and implement a sustainable national training program that builds the capacity of Health Care Workers (HCWs) and local organizations in Kenya through an academic model (HIV fellowship) of training to support the transition of HIV programs to local organizations in alignment with the Kenya National AIDS Strategic Plan III, Pillar 1 (Health sector HIV service d Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. objectives

The goal of the TBD will be to develop and implement a sustainable national training program that builds the capacity of Health Care Workers (HCWs) and local organizations in Kenya through an academic model (HIV fellowship) of training to support the transition of HIV programs to local organizations in alignment with the Kenya National AIDS Strategic Plan III, Pillar 1 (Health sector HIV service delivery). Fellows will undergo didactic and experiential learning in program leadership and management, health informatics, monitoring and evaluation or health economics.
The TBD will support establishment of a strong organizational capacity building framework for local organizations engaged in HIV program implementation and service delivery. TBD will also develop and implement fellowships to ensure capacity building of programs to address gaps in HIV service delivery and program management through the training of HCWs and organizational capacity building; monitor and evaluate the process and impact of the program on the trainees and local organization’s capacity to deliver effective, efficient and quality HIV services.
The Fellowship program will target service delivery HCWs, program managers and organizations supporting HIV services and programs to equip them with targeted skills and competencies through fellowship and training including multiple basic skills transfer through targeted short term training programs.
To ensure efficiency and cost effectiveness, TBD will support use of web-based and video-link lectures, pair each fellow with 2 medium term mentors from the participating local partner (PLP) organization; the two medium term trainees will assist the fellow in implementing a project in the host institution as part of their training.

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 2100 Pennsylvania Avenue, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20522, USA

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.

title.narrative: Annual Reports to Congress on the President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief

Audit of the Department of State’s Coordination and Oversight of the U.S. President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief
